item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "To die would be an awfully big adventure." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "To keep your secret is wisdom, but to expect others to keep it is folly." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Charles de Gaulle
item.description: "Silence is the ultimate weapon of power." -- Charles de Gaulle

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Dorothy Dix
item.description: "There is no weapon in the feminine armory to which men are so vulnerable as they are to a smile." -- Dorothy Dix

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by David Lloyd George
item.description: "Don't be afraid to take a big step if one is indicated. You can't cross a chasm in two small jumps." -- David Lloyd George

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "For after all, the best thing one can do when it is raining is let it rain." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "One should never trust a woman who tells one her real age. A woman who would tell one that would tell one anything." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Finley Peter Dunne
item.description: "The world is not growing worse and it is not growing better -- it is just turning around as usual." -- Finley Peter Dunne

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Tact: the ability to describe others as they see themselves." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "He that can have patience can have what he will." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by William G.T. Shedd
item.description: "A ship is safe in harbor, but that's not what ships are for." -- William G.T. Shedd

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Prejudice is a vagrant opinion without visible means of support." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Ingrid Bergman
item.description: "A kiss is a lovely trick designed by nature to stop speech when words become superfluous." -- Ingrid Bergman

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Will Rogers
item.description: "Everyone is ignorant, only on different subjects." -- Will Rogers

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "I intend to judge things for myself; to judge wrongly, I think, is more honorable than not to judge at all." -- Henry James

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Josh Billings
item.description: "The best time for you to hold your tongue is the time you feel you must say something or bust." -- Josh Billings

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "The liar's punishment is, not in the least that he is not believed, but that he cannot believe anyone else." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Mike Bell
item.description: "The chatterer reveals every corner of his shallow mind." -- Mike Bell

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description: "The Chinese use two brush strokes to write the word 'crisis.' One brush stroke stands for danger; the other for opportunity. In a crisis, be aware of the danger--but recognize the opportunity." -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Billy Graham
item.description: "When a brave man takes a stand, the spines of others are often stiffened." -- Billy Graham

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "Self-respect--the secure feeling that no one, as yet, is suspicious." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by James Russell Lowell
item.description: "A sneer is the weapon of the weak." -- James Russell Lowell

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "One has a right to judge a man by the effect he has over his friends." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "A torn jacket is soon mended, but hard words bruise the heart of a child." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Edmund Burke
item.description: "Woman is not made to be the admiration of all, but the happiness of one." -- Edmund Burke

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by William Hazlitt
item.description: "If I have not read a book before, it is, for all intents and purposes, new to me whether it was printed yesterday or three hundred years ago." -- William Hazlitt

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "The older I grow, the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Cori1312 add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it." -- Oscar Wilde
